programme.title: M-1 Challenge #64
programme.desc: M-1 Challenge is an MMA competition organized with a series of events held in many places around the world. The shows feature the best local and international fighters with spectacular Kos and submissions.

programme.title: M-1 Selection #3
programme.desc: The M-1 Selection is a MMA competition where the next generation of fighters are given the opportunity to showcase their skills on the world stage.

programme.title: Was Captain Smith Legally in Command of the Titanic?
programme.desc: Senan Molony has uncovered a completely overlooked Irish document, that seems to confirm Captain Smith was not legally in command of Titanic when she sailed from Southampton on April 10, 1912.

programme.title: Captain Smith's Saturday Afternoon Ice Briefing
programme.desc: Lightoller’s testimony before the commission confirms Captain Smith’s ice briefing to his officers long before Titanic reached the ice field.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Matching Shoes What Else Can That Be?
programme.desc: Ken Marschall, who’s been to the Titanic wreck six times, remembers standing at the door of Robert Ballard’s office and telling him, “I’ve found the bodies...”

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: Mystery Stairs On Titanic
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host Bill Sauder tells us that like any great English house, Titanic had her quirks; including hallways that seem to go nowhere and staircases that served no purposes. What were they thinking? Sauder will explain!

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Watertight Compartments
programme.desc: Can we design a passenger ship that is truly unsinkable? Parks Stephenson looks at that question as it relates to the design and effectiveness of watertight compartments both in 1912 and today.

programme.title: More Life Boats Would Not Have Helped
programme.desc: Have we been wrong all these years in thinking that more lifeboats would have saved lives? Haas makes a compelling case that this may have been just too simple of an answer.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Marconi Room
programme.desc: Ken Marschall shows us the remarkable surprises they found inside Titanic’s Marconi room during James Cameron’s 2001 and 2005 dives to the wreck.

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 1
programme.desc: Ken Marschall take us behind the scenes for a remarkable look at the making of James Cameron’s Titanic. If you’ve ever wondered how they built the ship and everything around it to look so real, this is an episode you can’t miss.

programme.title: Expedition Canada Season 2 Ep 2 (Eng)
programme.desc: Nathalie Long is trying to string together another world class expedition race. Episode 2 : Failed Attempt. A bear inspired trek, two rogue dogs, an inordinate amount of bushwhacking and that’s just the beginning. We meet a few of the teams and then Mike and Nat embark on an emporium fuelledbike ride through a maze of trails and roads in the Okanagan backwoods.

programme.title: The First Second - Sam Anthamatten
programme.desc: A specialist in high mountains, Sam is a committed freerider, but behind his instinct to ski, there is a guide: it is his job, his culture. At each line, an internal struggle begins between security and risk-taking ... The balance is difficult, with great freedom involved. Through his practice, he lives and perpetuates a mythical image, that of the Zermatt guide.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2024 - Episode 4
programme.desc: We will start this episode in Malaysia for the Melaka International Marathon. Moving then to another Marathon, the TUI Palma Marathon Mallorca. We then go to Saudi Arabia for the Tough Mudder Infinity obstacle race. Staying in Saudi Arabia, we discover the Saudi Freeride Flight 001, a brand new MTB freeride event. We then travel to Crete for the Pierra Creta: a bi-annual ski mountaineering race on Mount Psiloritis. Our journey continues in Greece, for a presentation of the 11th edition of XTERRA Greece.

programme.title: Nepal - The Other Side of Things
programme.desc: A unique spiritual voyage among the giant Himalayan mountains of Everest and Annapurna along ancient paths and across rivers, capturing the local beliefs to discover the marvels of an ancient mountain people in order to understand the meaning of self.

programme.title: Marathon Des Sables 2023 #0
programme.desc: Marathon Des Sables 2023 Day 0. On the MARATHON DES SABLES, Saturday is traditionally dedicated to the material and medical controls, an obligatory passage before attempting the ultimate desert adventure for the 1150 participants of the 37th edition. Marathon Des Sables 2023 Jour 0. Sur le MARATHON DES SABLES, le samedi est traditionnellement consacré aux contrôles matériel et médical, un passage obligé avant de tenter l’aventure désertique ultime pour les quelques 1150 participants de la 37e édition.

programme.title: Tour de France Prudential Singapore Criterium
programme.desc: The Tour de France Prudential Singapore Criterium race weekend includes races for both professionals and amateurs. The two-day programme culminates with the criterium race featuring 28 top international riders (Marc Cavendish, Tadej Pogacar, Peter Sagan ...) from 7 of the worlds best professional cycling teams (UAE Emirates, Cofidis, Bahrain Victorious ...)

programme.title: Cro Race 2023 Stage 5
programme.desc: Cro Race 2023 Stage 5 : CRIKVENICA-OZALJ

programme.title: 3 Nightmare Cycling Climbs
programme.desc: 3 Salite Da Incubo - Patrick Martini insieme a Emiliano Cantagallo, due ciclisti professionisti italiani ti accompagnano in tre delle più difficili e famose salite in bicicletta in Italia - nella regione del Friuli Venezia nelle Alpi Carniche. La prima salita è la Zoncolan, una corsa di 10 km con 1200 m di dislivello e uninclinazione media dell11,4 e uninclinazione massima del 22. La seconda salita è la Stentaria, un brutale giro di 7 km con 1100 m di dislivello, uninclinazione media del 18 e uninclinazione massima del 31! La terza salita è il Monte Crostis, una corsa di 14,5 km con una salita verticale di 1550 m, una pendenza media del 9,5 e una pendenza massima del 19. Sarai senza fiato ...Patrick Martini together with Emiliano Cantagallo, two Italian pro cyclists take you on three of the toughest and most famous cycling climbs in Italy - in the Friuli Venezia Region in the Carnic Alps. The first climb is the Zoncolan, a 10 km ride with 1200 m of vertical climb, and average incline of 11.4 and a max incline of 22. The second climb is the Stentaria, a brutal 7 km ride with 1100 m of vertical climb, an average incline of 18 and a max incline of 31 ! The third climb is the Mount Crostis, a 14.5 km ride with a vertical climb of 1550 m, an average incline of 9.5 and a max incline of 19. You will be breathless……

programme.title: Cro Race 2024 Stage 5
programme.desc: Cro Race 2024 Stage 5 : OZALJ (BOSILJEVO) - KARLOVAC

programme.title: Titan Desert Morocco 2018
programme.desc: A look back at the 2018 edition of the Garmin Titan Desert, a six-stage mountain bike race in the Moroccan desert. Orientation and endurance are two essential assets for a course that will make you discover the most incredible landscapes of Morocco over nearly 640 kilometers.

programme.title: The First Second - Vivian Bruchez
programme.desc: Ses yeux ne quittent jamais la montagne… Du premier coup d’oeil sur une face à la vision exigeante qui englobera tout, Vivian Bruchez avance comme un explorateur. Sa pratique de la pente raide est une marche vers l’inconnu, aussi enthousiaste que méthodique , une quête minutieuse du moindre détail, un parcours vers l‘accord avec lui-même.Vivian Bruchez - The Steep search. His eyes never leave the mountain ... From the first glance at a demanding vision that will encompass everything, Vivian Bruchez moves forward like an explorer. His practice of the steep slope is a march towards the unknown, as enthusiastic as it is methodical, a meticulous quest for the smallest detail, a journey towards agreement with himself.

programme.title: Desafio China by La Vuelta
programme.desc: Welcome to the first ever Desafío Beijing by La Vuelta in the Future Science City in the northern Changping district of Beijing. Over 1,100 amateur riders from all over China and some further field are on the start line of this unique event. Along with five of Vuelta legends in the first event of its type in china by La Vuelta — Spains biggest race, Pedro Delgado, Fabio Aru, Nicholas Roche, Joaquim Rodriguez and Alberto Contador.

programme.title: The Purpose (Eng)
programme.desc: Purpose is a longing, a celebration of the imagination, an invitation to a journey to the place of your deepest dreams. It is the engine that brings you closer to the vision of yourself, overcoming challenges, fulfilling dreams and achieving goals that you thought were unattainable, like running a race in the middle of the desert. Your purpose drives you from the depths of your being, it becomes your obsession and inspires you to find time where it seemed nonexistent, will where there used to be excuses, and energy in places where there used to be apathy. Your purpose will guide you to become the person you always dreamed of being, lead you to live the authentic life you long for, and lift you to a state of greatness. The Škoda Titan Desert Morocco can be explained in many ways: through its route, its landscapes, its winners... but there is no better way to do it than through its people. Their stories. The Purpose is a documentary that brings together and delves into five of the stories we experienced in the 2024 edition of the race. Stories of passion, overcoming, love and courage. Because it is them: Martí, Jan, Michal, Alejandra, Daniel and Konny who make a mountainbike race much more than that. Let it be a vital experience that changes lives.

programme.title: Hallberg Rassy - The Shipyard
programme.desc: Hallberg-Rassy is a company is based in Ellos, Sweden, and it has been building sailing boats since 1943. It is specialised in building bluewater sailing yachts. Our Federico Maselli is on-site to Show you around.

programme.title: Swan 55 – A winning bet
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the new sailing Yacht Swan 55 seen at Cannes International Boat Show 2022. Discover its performance.

programme.title: Outremer 52 - International Multihull Show 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the sailing catamaran Outremer 52, presented at the International Multihull Show 2023 in La Grande-Motte.

programme.title: Solaris 50 - Quality and value
programme.desc: Lights on the Solaris 50, a good boat, good value for money, solid contents and great fun. Here in Porto Piccolo discover the fifth model built, where the interiors have been designed by Lucio Micheletti, the yard’s technical department.

programme.title: ClubSwan 80 - My Song
programme.desc: Hop on board the latest My Song of Pigi Loro Piana, a ClubSwan 80.

programme.title: Cigarette 41 Nighthawk - High performance and style
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the Cigarette 41 Nighthawk is a boat that checks all the boxes. Discover the high performance and the style!

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2021 - Motor
programme.desc: Our Maurizio Bulleri is in Genova with the crew of The Boat Show for a special nautical appointment: the Genova Boat Show. What does this edition have in store for us? Discover all the news from the motor world.

programme.title: Quick SPA
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you inside the Quick SPA factory, a historic leader in excellent nautical components.

programme.title: Xenta and Castoldi - Teamwork
programme.desc: Hop on board the Castoldi JT 34 Open Limo and discover a new way of handling your boat. The one you are about to see is equipped with a Castoldi waterjet engine, while the command is from Xenta. Accuracy and safety are guaranteed.

programme.title: Beauty and art
programme.desc: The Boat Show welcomes you to Venice, a magical place for those who love beauty and art. Imagine navigating its water: what does the boat of your dreams look like? Could it be like this GV 30 Thunder by Vizianello? This water-limousines or top-of-the-range tender is elegant, practical and built skillfully, sized to resist the wave motion generated by the other boats that navigate this lagoon city.

programme.title: Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge - Built for cruising
programme.desc: Sam Orani invites you on board the Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge, on show at the Fort Lauderdale International. This is a very social boat, ideal for cruising.

programme.title: How to - Improve your sailing performance
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono shows all the functionality of the Raymarine Axiom 2 Pro and explains how to improve sailing performance with polar poles.

programme.title: MTI 440X FLIBS 2024 (Eng)
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show, aboard the MTI 440X, the largest outboard catamaran in the range. Designed to tackle more challenging seas, it offers a new 8-person layout and powerful performance, inheriting the success of the 340X and 390X models.

programme.title: Monaco Yacht Show - 2022
programme.desc: Welcome to Montecarlo for this new edition of the Monaco Yacht Show 2022. Let’s ear from some of the most important names in the nautical world.

programme.title: Scout Boats – Miami International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett sits down with Alan Lang, Director of Sales and Marketing for Scout Boats, to talk about the legacy of the Scout Boats range and the debut of the Scout Boats 670 in September.

programme.title: Miami International Boat Show 2024 - Accessories
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese takes you to discover the most innovative nautical accessories of the Miami International Boat Show 2024. The show is full of innovations and cutting-edge solutions proposed by companies from all over the world.

programme.title: DC Boat Show 2024 - Highlights
programme.desc: This years DC Boat Show at National Harbor offers plenty of attractions for boating enthusiasts. There are a wide variety of boats, as well as interactive events and exhibitor booths for everyone to enjoy.

programme.title: Camden Classic - 2023
programme.desc: Discover this year’s edition of The Camden Classics Cup, one of the world’s most beautiful regattas.

programme.title: Dockmate (Eng)
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono takes you to discover Dockmate, a real pocket helm station that ensures quick and easy mooring.

programme.title: MJM Yachts
programme.desc: A tour of the amazing factory of MJM Yachts, a company that meets the highest expectations for performance, usability, quality, and fuel efficiency.

programme.title: Simrad - Glass Bridge systems
programme.desc: Hop on board the maxi rib Ranieri International Cayman 45.0 Cruiser and test the Glass Bridge systems by Simrad, with two monitors that display a lot of information.

programme.title: All about Brunswick - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the Miami Boat Show and she is about to have a chat with David Foulkes, CEO of Brunswick Corporation.

programme.title: Best of Boot - 2023
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese and Federico Maselli bring you to the Boot, the International Boat Show in Dusseldorf. Discover the latest trends, the new accessories and technologies.

programme.title: 500 Offshore – A striking tender
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri is on board the 500 Offshore, a tender inspired by the iconic Fiat 500.

programme.title: Ocean Alexander - MIBS 2023

programme.title: Who Can I Run To?
programme.desc: Monica is the former lead singer of the three-girl group "Illicit" who were once an R&B powerhouse. She went on to have a less than stellar solo career but now feels there is something missing. When she reunites with her former group members, they try to show her that God is the answer to her plaguing questions and also the power in gospel music. Monica, on the verge of ending a loveless relationship, must decide if she is ready for the upheaval that her girlfriends suggest. The movie soars with love, gospel music and redemption.

programme.title: A Day Of Fire with Truck 4
programme.desc: 48 Hours with Truck 4s "C" Shift. They arrive on-scene to find a small trailer blazing and a possibly a dangerous situation with an LP gas tank near the trailer. The next day they are called in to a large apartment fire and our directed to perform one of the many things that the Fresno Fire Department does right, Salvage". They is where Firemen do their best to protect and preseve the belongs at the homes where there is a fire incident. Their respect for peoples homes and their personal property is something we have never seen with any other department. The truck crew starts salvage. In late afternoon, a call comes in as smoke showing from a building. The Truck Company arrives on scene of a Dollar Store and are directed to the rear. In the storage area, it is filled with smoke. The Crew bring out their thermal imagers and scan for hotspots.

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. On the program are Bach’s Orchestral Suite No. 4 in D major, BWV 1069; Gott der Herr ist Sonn und Schild, BWV 79; and Missa brevis in G major, BWV 236. The soloists are soprano Dorothee Mields, tenor Thomas Hobbs, countertenor Alex Potter, and bass Peter Kooij. The program continues with a fine selection of Bach’s works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford. On the program are Suite for lute in G minor, BWV 995; Suite for solo cello in G major (arr. for lute), BWV 1007; and Chaconne from Partita for solo violin in D minor (arr. lute), BWV 1004. This concert was recorded at Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, in 2017.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. On the program are Bach’s Orchestral Suite No. 4 in D major, BWV 1069; Gott der Herr ist Sonn und Schild, BWV 79; and Missa brevis in G major, BWV 236. The soloists are soprano Dorothee Mields, tenor Thomas Hobbs, countertenor Alex Potter, and bass Peter Kooij. The program continues with a fine selection of Bach’s works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford. programme.title: Leonard Slatkin & Orchestre National de Lyon - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Myung-whun Chung & Orchestra del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino - Mahler - Symphony No. 9
programme.desc: Maestro Myung-Whun Chung leads the Orchestra del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino in this touching performance of Gustav Mahler’s Symphony No. 9 in D major. Written in 1908-1909, it was the last symphony Mahler completed. Initially, the superstitious composer, believing in the so-called ‘curse of the ninth,’ did not want to write a Symphony No. 9. After all, fellow composers Ludwig van Beethoven and Anton Bruckner died before writing their tenth symphonies. Mahler’s Symphony No. 9 premiered on June 26, 1912, in Vienna, performed by the Vienna Philharmonic led by Bruno Walter. Unfortunately, the composer himself did not live to see this: he died in 1911. This performance was recorded at Teatro del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino in Florence, Italy, in 2021.

programme.title: Antonio Poli - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Ivan Fischer, Budapest Festival Orchestra & Richard Goode - Beethoven - Symphonies and Piano Concerto No. 4
programme.desc: Iván Fischer leads his Budapest Festival Orchestra (BFO) in a concert program dedicated to the music of Ludwig van Beethoven. The program opens with the composer’s Symphony No. 1 in C major, Op. 21. Afterward, Fischer conducts Beethoven’s Piano Concerto No. 4 in G major, Op. 58, in which Richard Goode features as the soloist. The acclaimed American pianist (1943) is known for his interpretations of the Beethoven repertoire. Goode recorded all five Beethoven piano concertos with the BFO and Fischer, earning him exceptional critical acclaim and a Grammy Award nomination. As an encore, Goode performs the Sarabande from J. S. Bach’s Partita in B-flat major, BWV 825. The program closes with Beethoven’s famous Symphony No. 5 in C minor, Op. 67. This performance was recorded at the Béla Bartók National Concert Hall in Budapest, Hungary, on January 29, 2017.

programme.title: John Coltrane - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: John Lewis - John Lewis: Piano Solo
programme.desc: Pianist John Lewis, co-founder and long-time leader of the legendary Modern Jazz Quartet, wrote jazz history with that band. His ability to blend classical forms with jazz improvisations singled him out as a unique artist, who was capable of transcending every musical barrier. When the Modern Jazz Quartet retired, John Lewis continued to work with other musicians and as a solo pianist. This program, recorded in studio conditions, features a spell-binding solo performance.

programme.title: Miles Davis - Joshua
programme.desc: American trumpeter Miles Davis (1926-1991) was a pioneering jazz musician from the late 1940s to the late 1980s. His influence on 20th century music is hard to overstate, as he trailblazed bebop, cool jazz, hardbop, modal jazz, and electronic music. On October 11, 1964, Miles Davis performed at Teatro Dell’Arte in Milan. With tenor saxophonist Wayne Shorter, pianist Herbie Hancock, bassist Ron Carter and drummer Tony Williams, Davis performed Autumn Leaves, My Funny Valentine, All Blues, All of You, and Joshua.

programme.title: Jimmy Witherspoon & Rozaa Wortham - Jimmy Witherspoon Quartet & Rozaa Wortham 1985
programme.desc: Since 1977, Estival is a summer jazz festival in Switzerland, Lugano. Estival offers a thrilling and particularly surprising line-up that explores the rich world of contemporary music whilst promoting the understanding of different cultures, tolerance, and co-existence. Jimmy Witherspoon and Rozaa Wortham, two incredible brilliant jazz musicians. Rozaa Wortham starts off the show with the Jimmy Witherspoon Quartet. Swinging and full of energy she performs ‘It Don’t Mean A Thing’. Jimmy Witherspoon, known for the song “Ain’t Nobody’s Business” ends the show with some astounding lean-back blues.

programme.title: Kenny Barron - Kenny Barron, Song for Abdullah
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. The revered elder statesmen of jazz piano brought his regular working trio of Kiyoshi Kitagawa (bass) and Jonathan Blake (drums), augmented by stellar jazzman Marcus Strickland (tenor saxophone) and young lion Riley Mulherkar (trumpet). Their seamless blend of classic bebop and modern explorations spoke of a deep, emotive connection to each note, captivating the Ukrainian audience with lyrical improvisations during this unforgettable concert.

programme.title: Curtis Stigers - Curtis Stigers - Fly Me To The Moon
programme.desc: The Danish Radio Big Band joins forces with American vocalist Curtis Stigers to celebrate Frank Sinatra's iconic concerts at The Sands Hotel in Las Vegas. Curtis Stigers and the big band present the most popular evergreens from the American songbook of the 1950s and 1960s, one of which is the classic that lend the concert its name: “Fly Me To The Moon”.

programme.title: Jazzmeia Horn - He's My Guy
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horn’s 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazz’s future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singer’s performance was a reminder of jazz’s enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horn’s concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: Earl Hines - Earl Hines Quartet in Spa, 1977
programme.desc: Despite his advanced age, the legendary jazz pianist Earl Hines was at the top of his game when he performed in the Belgian town of Spa in 1977. With a band consisting of Rudy Rutherford (reeds), Jimmy Leary (bass), and Eddie Graham (drums), Hines livens up the room with his interpretations of “I Can’t Believe That You’re In Love With Me” and “The Man I Love.” Marva Josie joins the group for soulful renditions of “A Sunday Kind of Love” and the well-known classic “Kansas City” before the set comes to a close with “Caravan,” which features a lengthy drum solo by Graham.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: Shanghai Me - A taste of 1930's China

One restaurant that’s capturing that flavour is Shanghai Me in Dubai’s financial district. Exuding the atmosphere the Orient, this establishment offers a unique dining experience. Euronews Evan Bourke paid a visit to meet Head Chef Shane Macneill, who cooked one of the restaurants signature dishes, black cod. Click on the video link above to watch the full episode.

programme.title: Discover the supersized attractions of Downtown Dubai, starting with the world’s tallest building
programme.desc: Downtown Dubai’s ample attractions include a 10-million litre aquarium, an Olympic-sized ice rink and the world’s tallest building. Nothing can prepare visitors for the true scale of record-breaking Burj Khalifa . At twice the height of the Empire State Building and almost three times the size of the Eiffel Tower, it soars 828 metres into the sky. Inside, there are 160 floors occupied by designer Giorgio Armani’s first-ever hotel , award-winning restaurants, luxury apartments and offices – and observation decks at levels 124, 125 and 148. Colourful wings, painted on observation deck windows, are designed for guests to pose between them. Part of the Global Angel Wings Project by Colette Miller, before appearing in Dubai, they were seen in Australia, China, Cuba, Europe, Kenya, Japan and the United States. The wings hint that humans can be angels of the earth and serve as a reminder to do good. Next door, The Dubai Mall houses more of Downtown Dubai’s supersized attractions. Visitors can cage-dive with sharks at the vast Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo and Dubai Mall’s indoor ice rink is an ample fit for professional figure skaters at 60 metres long; it can also snow here at the flick of a switch. While some attractions defy reality, others escape it altogether. Dubbed ‘The Centre of Now’, Downtown Dubai can take visitors to the future at the world’s largest VR Park in The Dubai Mall, a hive of virtual and augmented realities. Dubai in 2050 is the setting of indoor park’s augmented reality rollercoaster, made all the more exhilarating with headsets that place passengers in the cockpit of a computer-generated helicopter. As the virtual helicopter orbits out of the control, the very real, very fast rollercoaster cars plummet through loops and spin on their axes. Bustling with entertainment, Downtown Dubai’s high-octane epicentre is looped by the laidback, café-lined Sheikh Mohammad bin Rashid Boulevard – a starting point for a public art trail. Downtown Dubai is an urban canvas of sculptures

programme.title: "Veganity": World's largest vegan restaurant opened in Dubai
programme.desc: There is an undeniable trend towards a plant-based diet. In the UK, the number of vegans reportedly quadrupled between 2014 and 2018. Even fast-food giants are now offering vegan alternatives to meat. And here in Dubai, a restaurant billed as the worlds largest vegan restaurant (‘Veganity’) has just opened its doors. Veganity’s founder Sky Sommer’s business was borne of her desire to show people that having a plant-based diet does not have to be a sacrifice. With over 200 dishes on the menu, everything from soul food to gourmet food are on offer. Sommer’s favourite dish is Molokhia; a recipe which has its roots in Ancient Egypt. “Its actually the name of a leaf; a greeny leaf that looks like spinach. So you just put olive oil, onions and garlic and coriander. This is what gives it that kick. Tomato paste, white vinegar, vegetable stock. Once you add the molokhia and the tomato paste you just let it boil to render down a bit. It becomes a bit thick and then you just get a hand blender.” Below weve provided a delicious Vegan recipe for you to try at home. Recipe Laham Ajeen Chop tomatoes x4 Diced onions x2 Garlic diced x8 Parsley chopped x1 bunch Red capsicum small squares x1 Green capsicum small squares x1 Minced meat (TVP) 250g Cook all together with 3-4 tablespoons of olive oil for around 10 minutes then add the spices below until they are well combined: Paprika x 4 tablespoons 7 spices x 4 tablespoons Garlic powder x 2 tablespoons Vegan Worcester sauce x 1 tablespoons Tomato paste x 4 tablespoons Vegetable stock x 1 cup Leave to marinate for up to 1 hour stirring it every 15 min till all liquids have dissolved then serve with half a lemon slice. The dough 5 cups of flour of choice 2 cups water Pinch of salt Sieve the flour into a bowl Add the salt Slowly add the water bit by bit while mixing the dough, cover and let rest for 30 minutes in a cool place then roll out to a clean surface and need for 5 min. Then cut the dough into 3 inch balls and roll the do

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: Ventura County Coast's Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Outdoor enthusiasts will find everything from mountains to islands in Ventura County. Our local experts tell us where to hike, bike, run, golf and swim.

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Come visit Wuzhen, a 1,300-year-old water town on the lower reaches of the Yangtze River. Located on the Hangzhou-Jiaxing-Huzhou Plain in northern Zhejiang Province, it isat the center of the golden triangle consisting of Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou. The most famous of the six “watertowns” in China, Wuzhen is commonly called “the Venice of the East” so taking a boat ride through the towns storied canals is a must. If you are going to make a day out of it, we recommend exploring the East section during the day and visiting the West section after 5p when the tourist crowds die down.

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: Working While Black: Overcoming Racial Bias, Microagressions & Burnout
programme.desc: Learn tips and tools from executives who have successfully overcome the most common and unique hurdles that we face in business. Unchecked and these can do damage by derailing us. Alisa Gumbs, Executive Managing Editor for Black Enterprise, leads a panel discussion with Karen S. Carter, Chief Human Resources Officer & Chief Inclusion Officer at Dow Chemical Co.; Minda Harts, Founder & CEO, The Memo LLC; and Sandra Sims-Williams, Senior Vice President for Diversity & Inclusion at Nielsen, to explore, demystify and help strip these common detailers of their power. Lessons from the 2020 Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

programme.title: The Force Behind Power 105.1 Morning Radio
programme.desc: Our guests are the force behind Power 105.1 Breakfast Club: Angela Yee, Charlamagne, and DJ Envy. We witness how their chemistry is waking up Americans across the country. Plus, we see why Power 105.1s is the Voice of America, Angie Martinez, who shares the inspiration behind her move from one radio station to another. And while Americans took sides, Angie tells us why she did it. Then were keeping up with the Joneses. The husband-and-wife team Arsha and Charles Jones, co-owner of Capital City Mambo Sauce, proves that when we cant find a product we want, then we should go make it ourselves. Well never know how successful the business will be until we fill that void. And finally, we feature Charlene Dance, marketing director for Strength of Nature Global. She spearheaded a partnership between the haircare manufacturing company she works for and a nonprofit organization to help women dress for success.

programme.title: Fighting for Our Environment with Wawa Gatheru
programme.desc: Wawa Gatheru, one of the world’s most influential environmental justice advocates, shares why Black women are at high risk in the climate crisis.

programme.title: Legacy and Values: Building Black Generational Wealth
programme.desc: There is far more to multigenerational wealth creation than making money and building investment portfolios. Successfully transferring wealth from one generation to the next is also about passing on the values and principles, not just assets. Prudential VP of Business Development Keita Cline joins Your Money Your Life to underscore how a family’s commitment to shared values, communicating financial goals, and financial education can lay a sound foundation of wealth for generations to come.

programme.title: Lynae Vanee Talks Power, Purpose, and 'The People’s Brief'
programme.desc: Multi-hyphenate creator, poet, and cultural commentator Lynae Vanee steps into the spotlight as the host of "The People’s Brief," REVOLT’s raw and unapologetic news commentary series. In this exclusive Black Enterprise interview with Selena Hill, the three-time NAACP Image Award nominee shares her journey from high school teacher to digital powerhouse, and unpacks her vision for truth-telling, creative freedom, and the future of Black America.

programme.title: It's the Tony Awards Season with Kenny Leon
programme.desc: We salute excellence in Broadway theater with a look at some of the past Tony Award winners and nominees who appeared on our show. We profile Director Kenny Leon, who received a nominations for Best Director in “A Raisin in the Sun.” Plus, we remember Nicole Ari Parker and Blair Underwood who appeared on Broadway in “A Streetcar Named Desire.” Then, we look back at David Alan Grier, who played a mean villan in “Porgy & Bess.” And finally, Alicia Keys discovered how sticky being a Broadway producer can be when was the force behind “Stick Fly.”

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls - The Men: Episode 4
programme.desc: In the ultimate survival experiment, Bear Grylls has abandoned 14 British men on a remote desert island in the Pacific with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. This time the survival challenge is harder than ever, as they attempt to survive entirely on their own wits for six weeks in the height of the tropical storm season. It’s four days since then men trapped and killed a crocodile, and they haven’t been able to repeat their success. Most of the meager meals they are eating are coming from cleaning facilities manager, Vic, who has is the only member of the group to mastered his improvised fishing rod.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls - The Women: Episode 4
programme.desc: In the ultimate survival experiment, Bear Grylls has abandoned 14 British women on a remote desert island in the Pacific with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. This time the survival challenge is harder than before, as they attempt to survive entirely on their own wits for six weeks in the height of the tropical storm season. The extreme conditions on the island are taking their toll on the 11 remaining women and they are now on the brink of starvation. They are living on an extreme low calorie diet, surviving on snails and limpets and scraps of scavenged yucca and coconut.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls - The Women: Episode 5
programme.desc: In the ultimate survival experiment, Bear Grylls has abandoned 14 British women on a remote desert island in the Pacific with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. As the group approaches the four week mark of the experiment, the 10 remaining women are entering dangerous medical territory. With very little research about how the body copes with extreme survival beyond this point, it’s more important than ever that they keep up their food and water supply otherwise they risk long term damage to their vital organs. Yesterday the women feasted on their first big kill – a large pig. 25 year old Nurse Lauren along with 30 year old potter Beth have stayed up all night to preserve the left-over pork, requisitioning one of the group’s two precious jerrycans – normally reserved for their water purification system.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls - The Men: Episode 5
programme.desc: In the ultimate survival experiment, Bear Grylls has abandoned 14 British men on a remote desert island in the Pacific with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. The survival challenge is harder than ever, as they attempt to survive entirely on their own wits for six weeks in the height of the tropical storm season. In this episode, the emergency evacuation team are called in when 36 year old, Will, falls off a cliff on to rocks, badly injuring himself.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls - The Women: Episode 6
programme.desc: In the ultimate survival experiment, Bear Grylls has abandoned 14 British women on a remote desert island in the Pacific with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. The survival challenge is harder than ever, as they attempt to live entirely on their own wits for six weeks in the height of the tropical storm season. The women are starving as they enter their sixth and final week on The Island. Having plundered all the resources in the vicinity of their beach, the group are now looking to the ocean to sustain them. The women are pinning all their hopes on their fishing net catching a major haul but so far it’s eluded them.

programme.title: The Kardashians vs. Jordyn Woods
programme.desc: S1:E4 Jordyn Woods was somebody the Kardashian family trusted. But all that changed when rumours of her being a home wrecker emerged after a scandalous yet confusing night at a party with Khloé Kardashian’s then-boyfriend and NBA player, Tristan Thompson. Our team investigated both sides of the story and got the real truth about what happened that night.

programme.title: Amber Rose vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E5 it true that Kanye West was harassing Amber Rose when she suddenly left him? When Kanye West started dating Amber Rose, he took her from the life of being a stripper to the global superstar world. At first, they seemed like a couple that was truly in love. But when Amber suddenly left Kanye, his attitude towards her completely changed. Our team uncovered the real story behind the tabloids of the years of bullying, unwanted media attention, and attacks that Amber had to suffer. The true story will reveal why she was the special woman Kanye fell in love with in the first place, and what she and Kim Kardashian have in common.

programme.title: Ariana Grande vs. Pete Davidson
programme.desc: S1:E11 What made Kanye West go to war against Pete Davidson? Kanye is relentlessly going after Pete, so much so, that Kim Kardashian is concerned about the safety of her new boyfriend. Is it because Kanye knows Pete’s history of controversial relationships? Our team got the real story behind the tabloids, the truth behind Pete’s behavior in relationships, and the journey he went on to truly start loving who he is.

programme.title: Rihanna vs. Chris Brown
programme.desc: S1:E1 Rihanna found herself the victim of assault, from her best friend and then-boyfriend, Chris Brown. Not only was she humiliated in front of the world, but she also faced further attacks from the media, some going as far as claiming the violence was her fault. We uncovered the real story of Rihanna’s experience during and after the incident, not the one portrayed by the media, where she shows us why she is the strong, compassionate, graceful woman the world fell in love within the first place.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: The Rise of Rocky NoHands
programme.desc: S1:E4 How would you feel if you lost in Fortnite to one of the worlds best players, and found out he was using his mouth as a controller? RockyNoHands is a professional eSports Fortnite player, making a career of playing a video game he loves and being among the best in the world at it. After the darkest moment of Rocky’s life left him paralyzed and motionless in a hospital bed, doctors told him he may never walk again. It wasn’t until a source of pure motivation forced him to dig deep to find his unbreakable drive, that he was able to take on his biggest and most rewarding challenge yet.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: Tupac Shakur: Fight For A Better World
programme.desc: Legendary hip hop artist Tupac Shakur left this world far too early, but it’s clear that he and his music had a lasting impact. Surrounded by violence and injustice Tupac fought for a better world.

programme.title: Jennifer Asberson: When Rejection Turns Deadly
programme.desc: On September 27, 1992, 19 year old Jennifer Asbenson accepts a ride from a stranger after missing her bus to work. When the man asks for her number, she gives him a fake one to be safe and forgets about it, unaware that she has just refused the advances of a deranged serial killer. At the end of her shift that morning, she does not make it back home. Jennifer escapes twice, yet no one believes what has happened to her. 5 years later, his arrest would reveal the most shocking information.

programme.title: Kevin Berthia: The Golden Gate Bridge Guardian Angel
programme.desc: Kevin Berthia tells the true story of how the power of listening and hope saved him from the darkest moment of his life on the Golden Gate Bridge.

programme.title: Kailash Satyarthi: Man vs. Mafia
programme.desc: Nobel Peace Prize Winner Kailash Satyarthi has dedicated his life to ending child trafficking in India. Hes freed over 87,000 children from horrific slave-like conditions, but he couldnt save the one person who mattered most...Why does he continue to risk his life to end child labor?

programme.title: Lauren Wasser: The Model With Golden Legs
programme.desc: Lauren Wasser was thriving as a young fashion model, but her life quickly took a dramatic turn when she fell victim to Toxic Shock Syndrome. What started as a normal day for Lauren ended with her being found on the bedroom floor just 10 minutes away from losing her life. Luckily, Lauren survived but was tragically forced to lose both her legs. It seemed like her fashion career was over. But instead, the unthinkable happened.

programme.title: Mandy Harvey: Feeling the Music
programme.desc: When Mandy Harvey completely lost her hearing, her dreams of a career in music came crashing down! Although she could not even hear her own voice, her family encouraged her to pursue her passion and NEVER QUIT. Thats when she went on Americas Got Talent and SHOCKED the entire nation, including Simon Cowell himself!

programme.title: Curtis Martin: Running Towards Success
programme.desc: Legendary NFL Player Curtis Martin enjoyed great success playing for the New England Patriots and the New York Jets. After retiring, he was inducted to the Pro Football Hall of Fame…. yet he openly admits that he really didn’t want to play football and that he was forced into it. What dark trauma from his childhood almost kept him from realizing his true dream and the greatest opportunity of his life?

programme.title: Elon Musk: Revenge of the Geeks
programme.desc: Visionary entrepreneur, Elon Musk achieved the impossible with SpaceX and Tesla, but Elon’s success made people question his “real intentions”. A look inside his childhood reveals why Elon lived in fear as a child, and why he never talks about his father...

programme.title: Aron Ralston: The True Story Behind 127 Hours
programme.desc: Pinned down by a rock in a desert canyon miles away from civilization, Aron Ralston spent days trapped, thinking he was going to die. But something happened that changed his outlook and gave him the determination to fight for his life.

programme.title: Kevin Berthia: The Golden Gate Bridge Guardian Angel
programme.desc: Kevin Berthia tells the true story of how the power of listening and hope saved him from the darkest moment of his life on the Golden Gate Bridge.

programme.title: From Thief to Self-Made Millionaire
programme.desc: Watch John Assarafs personal story of growth, the lessons he learned early on in life, and how he went from robber to self-made millionaire by brushing his teeth.

programme.title: Blue or Red pill?
programme.desc: Mindvalley founder Vishen Lakhiani shares the secret to success and teaches a confused student how to make the right decisions in life. The choice is yours: Will you take the blue pill or the red pill?

programme.title: Rock Thomas - Rock Bottom
programme.desc: Rock Thomas delivers a powerful, personal story on how to resist the labels forced on you in order to redefine yourself

programme.title: COST INCREASE: 2 NEW Part D Rules Will INCREASE Cost For Many!
programme.desc: Marvin Musick from Medicare School is here to give you the latest updates to Medicare Part D plans and their prescription drug coverage for 2024. There are new Part D rules that could lead to increased out-of-pocket expenses for some. Hes here to help make sure you choose the right plan and make sure you can distinguish the important distinctions between preferred and standard pharmacies and the essential utilization rules like quantity limits, step therapy, and prior authorization. Marvin will also help you secure Part D coverage, whether as a standalone plan or as part of a Medicare Advantage Plan. These 2024 changes increase deductibles and the adjustments in the coverage gap phase for many, but exactly who? He also brings attention to the positive changes brought by the Inflation Reduction Act, particularly the reduced out-of-pocket costs once reaching the catastrophic coverage phase.

programme.title: Blending
programme.desc: One of the keys of impressionism is the blending together of images. The definition of this movement in art is characterized by visible brush strokes, ordinary subject matters, and an emphasis on light and its changing qualities. The first project is an impressionistic landscape using oil pastels and black mat board. Then we're using dye in spray bottles to make colorful geometric designs. Learn about color blending using special tools to create interesting effects in your art journal. And finally, blend colored glue to create a piece of art.

programme.title: HANGMAN
programme.desc: Two Iraq war vets Nick and Lenny return to the hometown of their ex girlfriends to see if they can rekindle the flames. What should be a little R&R in the woods slowly turns into Murder & Mayhem, when they take off with the girls to an abandoned cabin on their closed Alma Mater campus. There they fall prey to a deadly game of Hangman. This one comes complete with a real noose for the losers. Lust soon gives way to suspicion and fear as they turn on each other to survive. Only the Hangman knows who will win this game

programme.title: EXECUTION
programme.desc: Ten years after a tragic childhood attack, that took his first and only love, a man awakens from a coma and begins killing everything in his path. Seemingly random murders begin to unfold into a mysterious story of revelation, intrigue and redemption. Execution is an eclectic blend of Comedy, Horror and Romance.

programme.title: LOVE ON A LEASH

programme.title: The Urgent Moment
programme.desc: On the eve of the Long March, the Red Army suffered heavy losses under the command of the erroneous military line of Li De and Bogu and was in a completely passive position. The Red Army made a decision on a strategic shift. Meanwhile the Red Expansion Movement in the Soviet Region was being carried out enthusiastically, and Liu Zao, a famous medical successor who was determined to go to the battlefield, joined the Red Army team. The Independent Regiment with Xiao Qiang as the regiment commander and the Red Ninth Regiment with Chen Xiong as chief of staff were ordered to go to the front line to replace the Red Army team that had previously carried out the peripheral cover mission. They launched an arduous blockade battle against the Kuomintang reactionary troops who frantically attacked the Soviet region on different battlefields. At this time, the Military Commission issued an urgent order, ordering Xiao Qiang to lead his troops to the battlefield of Laoyingpan to rescue the seriously wounded commander of the Western army. After learning that the commander of the Western Army of the Red Army had been wounded in the battle on the front line of Laoyingpan, the Central Revolutionary Military Commission urgently ordered Xiao Qiangs independent regiment to rush to the front line to rescue. Under the blockade of the enemy, Commander Chen was successfully rescued in the battlefield of Laoyingpan, but was in a critical situation. Fortunately, Chen Xiong led the 9th Red Regiment to meet from the periphery, and after a hard battle, he broke through the enemys blockade and successfully transferred Commander Chen to the 8th Rear Hospital of the Red Army. After further treatment, he was sent to the Jiangxi Military District Hospital in Anfu, Ningdu.Upon completing the rescue and escort mission, Xiao Qiang received an order from the Central Revolutionary Military Commission: to form a pioneer reconnaissance company called Sword of Xingguo to carry out special combat tasks for the column of the Military Commission.

programme.desc: Deivamagal is an Indian Tamil-language soap opera starring Vani Bhojan and Krishna. Kumarans successful soap, Thirumathi Selvam, and replaced by Nayagi. The show is produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S. Kumaran. This serial was shot in Pollachi, Chennai, Chengalpet, Hyderabad, Kerala, Puducherry, and Cuddalore.
